From letting you walk out that door the last time, I never should have let you. I had laid my heart out on the table, and your rejections I took to mean you just didnt want me, so I let you leave. Had I known there was even the smallest part of you that still wanted me, I believe I would have stopped you, it would have been enough for me. But then again I don't believe I deserved to have you back then. You were the best thing in my otherwise dark life, you had been the only one to ever stand beside me and try to make me a better person. I look back now and can see that clearly, but I was so blinded by my own demons and rage. Yet there you were through it all, you were with me through the bad times, more then anyone else ever has even through my good times. 

I should have listened to my heart that day in the park, when you asked me what I wanted. My heart wanted to tell you so badly, but the rest of me just stood there like an idiot. I should have appreciated you, and the way you tried to get me away from those things that were pulling me back. body:
Steel cables stretch across the desert floor....relief dips in the eighties. There are visions of Carrot Top dancing in my head...dancing and dancing...
I think I can hear it now, the distant buzz of those neon signs you talked so much about.

I think I'm losing my f***ing mind.
Put on a brave face kid. Sleep is for the weak he said,
those sad beautiful eyes fixed on mine.
God, those eyes...
Who's weak now? I never thought I'd live to see the day.
You were supposed to be invincible. You promised you would be okay.

What the f*** do I do now?
I miss that smoke filled car. I remember the way your delicate tracks felt beneath my fingertips, the way my chest would ache as I'd choke back the tears... the way my touch could diminish any trace of that ego you held so dear.
I miss the wandering fingertips, I miss your passionate kiss.
I miss feeling so f***ing small and fragile in your arms, the arms that I always thought would be waiting there to keep me safe. I miss being vulnerable.

I miss you being the smoke, no...
I miss you being MY smoke.
I remember watching as you rose to the ceiling, I remember the fleeting but inevitable feeling in my heart right before you slipped through the cracks...the emptiness I feel now, just a painful reminder that I could have pulled you back.

I can't stop wondering what would have happened,
what could have happened...
I can't accept that it doesn't even matter anymore.

I would give anything.
F***ing anything. I don't know why I didn't stay the whole night through, I don't think I'll ever know. I don't think I'll ever stop asking myself. I should have held you closer, kissed you more... I should have let you in. I know that now...

I would have hopped on that train, you know it's true.
No destination, nothing but an adventure with you. 
But you said you would be okay.

You f***ing said you would be okay....

"I love the person I become when I'm with you"
All I wanted was for it to be real.

I'm lost without you. Please know...

body:
Lovesick was the illness
That clouded his mind,
Life that lacked fullness
Held him back with time.

Slipping past the days 
With spiked Earl-Greys,
There lived a boy by the bay
Seeking some change.

He called out the winds,
"Forgive all my sins!"
With the poke of a pin
Weakness came over him.

Vision became a kaleidoscope,
Words sounded like a choke,
And his body was trying to cope
With this apparent stroke.

His mind seemed just fine,
A grace of nature's charms,
But there was a shine in his eyes
As wings grew out of his arms .

His mouth became a beak,
Claws made up his feet.
A change of his heart within
And fur had covered his skin

This is not a story just about how,
A certain boy became an owl.
But the love he experienced 
In all of it's mysteriousness.

For when he flew to a tree,
A creature was staring at he
And was as beautiful as could be--
Snowy white fur and eyes emerald green.

Nearly exhausted of patience
And dried out expectations,
She had been waiting for Macon
At that specific location.

While he'd been frantically chasing
Searching with determination.
He would've searched the nations
For the owl that now faced him

He hoo'd out a, "Hi"
She hoo'd, "Hello"
"I've been searching high"
"I've been staying low" 

"I really miss you," He hoo'd,
"I'm sorry for ever being rude." 
She apologized for the mood, 
"I'm still pissed about that time you showed up nude."

He knew about what she spoke
But hoped it wouldn't be mentioned.
So he said sorry for causing the tension,
To never be forgotten was his only intention

And with their mind's ascension
Through time's dimension,
They gained full comprehension
Of each other's attention and affection

Love had finally come to these two.
There was only one think left to do,
With their vows they will conclude 
And then together they hoo'd, "I do."

He married her spirit that night,
Glistening under a full moon,
Sealing a ring on her finger tight,
He must now wait until June

When they finished with a kiss,
Macon suddenly awoke with his wits
And a burning passion to persist
Cuz buried in his mind is his promise

Now he medicates for all his conditions,
Drugs that help him with his transitions.
Pills he must take, ordered by physicians
To calm the boy of his current disposition 

His meds help cure delusions,
But make him forget his illusions
And solutions to the confusion.
He feels he belongs in an institution.

He refuses to believe in himself
While using such medical "help,"
Since he can't talk to his muse--
The only one who can ignite the fuse

To get him back on his feet.
A challenge I wish you to meet.
Lay it on him with compassion
And he will rise from the ashes.
